newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB still sees higher 1996 net.
newsitem.headline: ABB still sees higher 1996 net.

text.p: ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG repeated that it still expects net profit for 1996 to exceed 1995's net profit on a comparable basis.
"As stated previously, on a comparable basis, net income for the full year of 1996 is expected to increase over 1995," ABB said in its nine month report.

ABB reported a 1995 net profit of $1.315 billion, but this result was inflated by a one-time payment of $250 million from Daimler-Benz in connection with the creation of a joint venture in rail transportation.
ABB has made it clear that its forecast for a higher 1996 profit "on a comparable basis" refers to this payment.
Excluding this payment, ABB would have reported a net profit of $1.065 billion in 1995.
